39351980.review:
[h1] Не обижайте младших по должности[/h1]

[i] Commander Cool 2[/i] – самый обычный инди платформер. В отличии от многих других инди собратьев здесь есть сюжет. Он простой и банальный, но подаётся в виде двух роликов, а не каким-нибудь описанием перед началом игры, как это принято. Наш герой чем-то напоминает Дюка, только не пьёт и не разговаривает. И вот наш брутальный подопечный вынужден скитаться по 34 уровням отстреливая древних людей, динозавров и хищные растения из современных стволов. Так же нам дают 3 челенджа перед началом каждого уровня: не получить урона, уложиться в определённое время и собрать все звёздочки. Помимо звёздочек на каждом уровне есть алмаз, собрав определённое количество которых, можно поменять скин гг. Боссы просты, никаких хитрых подходов к ним искать не нужно, долби знай из своей пушки. Никаких сложно-построенных уровней нет, разве что [i] Orlyapps[/i] на некоторых уровнях переборщили с летающими камнями.

Среди прочих неровностей стоит отметить не самую гладкую механику прыжков, а ещё снарядам свойственно пролетать сквозь птеродактилей. А так никаких багов, всё хорошо. Графика неплоха, радует рисовка нпс и детализация, но больше ничего выдающегося не встретить. Звуки несколько резки, хотелось бы слышать что-нибудь более разнообразное и обработанное. Музыка нейтральна, главное не стала раздражать даже после двух часов игры.

Ну вот неправильно в 2015 году добавлять локальный кооператив, когда на дворе эпоха интернета, поэтому с вероятностью 99,9% вы будете проходить в одиночку. В режиме против друг друга вы уж точно долго не зависните, будете постоянно прыгать и пытаться попасть в оппонента, периодически падая в пропасть.

[i] Commander Cool 2[/i] средняя игрушка, её на за что ругать и плеваться на неё, за исключением пару моментов, но при этом и похвалить то не за что. Маленькая длительность идёт на руку игре, ведь из-за недостатка красок в геймплее процесс прохождения заставляет скучать. Поэтому я всё также рекомендую среди игр подобного жанра из андерграунда [i] 8BitBoy[/i] и [i] Bloo Kid 2[/i].

35539834.review:
Commander Cool 2 - инди-игра (компьютерная игра, созданная отдельным разработчиком или небольшим коллективом без финансовой поддержки издателя компьютерных игр), стиль игры ретро и платформер. Много отрицательных обзоров, но могу уверить, что они несут бестолковый характер, "не понравилось", "унылое ***", "примитивная анимация" и т.п. Согласитесь, полезной информации, выжать для себя очень трудно и не понятно, что из себя игра представляет. Во-первых, игра рассчитана на молодое поколение игроков, она очень энергична и требует быстрого прохода, каждого уровня, одним словом - экшен. Во-вторых, играть рекомендуется с контроллером, нежели с клавиатурой - это важно, хотя я и проходил без проблем на клавиатуре, тут 10-15 минут, откалибровать свой мозг под управление и всё пойдет, как по маслу. В-третьих, играть можно, кооперативом, с лимитом до четырех игроков, так заявлено. На самом деле я не в курсе, в кооператив не играл, поэтому заявлять о его работоспособности не стану. В-четвертых, игра, несмотря на инди, выполнена на профессиональном уровне, работает без проблем, вылетов и ошибок в ней не обнаружил.
Рекомендую - только для тех, кто любит игры в стиле труднопроходимые, с быстрым реагированием на препятствия и врагов.

這是款小品的動作、合作解謎遊戲。移動方式除了基本的走跳外，也有二段跳、三角跳，以及在地圖上可吃到的各種武器，有些槍械甚至有後座力 XD。因此動作上的自由度很大，某種程度上也造成了關卡設計上，對於移動的失誤容錯率較低的狀況，不過還好他是 HP 制，不致於因為一次失誤而重玩整關。

對於此遊戲動作的物理性，比方說跳起的速度比落下要快「很多」這點，不像一般遊戲可以由跳躍鍵按的時間長度來微調高度，如果以一般動作遊戲的習慣來玩，將很容易因為跳躍按太久，而導致二段跳的高度不足，造成通關上的一些不便，還需要特別去適應。

他本來就只是個小品，玩起來像個尋常的小遊戲也是難免的 XD

目前還在 Early Access 階段，其實也沒啥好評的。
不過以一款 Early Access 階段的遊戲來說，還算穩定，至少沒遇到什麼重大 bug。

18479961.review:
[h1]Entretenido, variado y algo viciante[/h1]

Un videojuego en el que tienes que ir por detrás de un viejo malhumorado con una máquina del tiempo Región 4 que a duras penas logra funcionar. Commander Cool 2 trae consigo una serie de niveles en las que debes superar uno por uno, pero con la funcionalidad de que puedes ganar 1 de 3 estrellas si logras: terminar el nivel en menos de 25 segundos o menos, terminar el nivel sin daños y, la más entretenida, finalizar el nivel obteniendo todas las monedas a lo largo de los niveles. Eso sí, con la posibilidad de «capturar» un tipo de cristal —que me recuerda mucho a Crash— en diferentes puntos de los niveles. Y aquí es un punto importante, pues no todos los cristales son fáciles de capturar. Necesitarás de tu imaginación para saber cómo obtenerla.

Un aspecto negativo, pero no por ello menos importante, es el idioma; y es que a pesar de ser un juego simple y con mecánicas meramente casuales, puede llegar a aburrir al jugarlo. Sobre todo, si no dominas el idioma y no sabes cómo ganar una de las tres estrellas porque no sabes qué significa lo que te pide el juego. Una breve traducción o tutorial en español no estaría de más para aquellos que no dominen el inglés. Otro aspecto negativo es la IA de los enemigos; no son más que monótonos moviéndose de un lado para otro una y otra vez, sin embargo, si no te pones las pilas puedes morir por unas rocas arrojadas por cavernícolas, o bien, ser empujado por una cabezota de una señora que llegó a la menopausia.

El sonido... no es de alabar, cumple su función; pero, no es algo que llegue a emocionarte, ya que no logra emocionarte del todo. Eso sí, hay unas canciones que son entretenidas, pero hasta ahí.

En resumen, Commander Cool 2 es un videojuego Indie perfecto para pasar un rato. Con una jugabilidad sumamente sencilla y niveles algo variopintos con montañas, volcanes y paisajes muy propios en la era de los dinosaurios de fondo. Incluye logros y cromos, ¡algo bueno y a su favor! Pero que recomiendo jugarlo en Android, ya que queda mejor en dispositivos móviles y muy poco en PC.

[b]7.5/[/b]

Неплохой платформер с приятной графикой и кооперативом до четырех игроков. Суть каждого уровня - как можно быстрее дойти до машины времени, попутно собирая все монетки и расстреливая всю живность, каждые несколько уровней - босс. 

Есть возможность кастомизации персонажа путем смены костюмов, которые открываются по мере прохождения игры. Также присутствует встроенный редактор уровней, таблица рекордов и КОЛЛЕКЦИОННЫЕ КАРТОЧКИ стима. 

В результате мы имеем приятную игру для компании, без каких-либо свежих идей, но при этом способную увлечь на один-два вечера.

17936269.review:
TLDR:
Commander Cool is a boring game which does not provide anything special. It is not worth the money and You could easily find better games over the Internet for free, playable in a browser. Although, it may be enjoyable for some people.

Details:

+ Graphic: well-made levels and characters as well as animations (I somehow really liked them).
+ Weapons.
+ Sound effects are nice and music is enjoyable.

- No tutorial or anything like that. Personally, I could not even figure out how to start a coop game. I have tried all the buttons on my keyboard and I still could not find correct key to make 2nd or any other player join.
- Game gets boring pretty quickly because of repetetive gameplay - it does not offer anything besides every other platform game. Personally, I have given up after beating about 25 levels - I wanted to complete the whole game but I simply could not stand it anymore.
- Controls are somehow bad and do not respond well, especially the movement.
- Bugs and glitches: perhaps there are not many of them but they happen sometimes - I got stucked few times, experienced random game crashes.
- Price is too high as for such a game.

17927968.review:
Commander Cool 2 feels like a great Platformer and also has Coop which is a great bonus!

It can be quite hard, but you quickly start over with your infinite life, so you can run back and figure out a new way to proceed through the level, which is quite nice.

The cartoonish style is also made pretty well, its some nice drawings and they fit well into the game and It also has Steam Achievements, Trading Cards and full Controller Support which is pretty neat.

TLDR:

+Cool cartoonish graphics.
+Nice music picks.
+Good Platformer and very challenging if you try to beat it all with 3 Stars.
+4 Player Local co-op with also a 4 Player Versus Mode.
+Full Controller Support, Achievements and Steam Trading Cards.

+/-Can become abit boring in length.
+/-Good boss fights overall, but has a very hard end-game boss which mostly feels hard cause of game mechanics being difficult to control, it might need a fix i think.

-Very Repetitive.
-Few different Monsters and Weapons to fight with.
-Missing more variety of different looking levels and stuff in general.
-Not very much extra content available, only a few different character picks.

Overall during Early Access, i will give the game a 4/10.

P.S. I Won Commander Cool 2 in a Giveaway from Orlygift!

Commander Cool 2 is a platforming shooter that has you fighting your way through the stone age in all sorts of unlockable costumes with a variety of weapons. On paper, the game sounds like a blast and for the most part it is. There are just a few things holding it back like jumping issues, game length and how easy it is. Since this is an Early Access game, the short length is forgivable. There’s hopefully more to come and the thirty levels show enough promise and let you get a real feel for the game and what its capable of.

The easy difficulty makes it the perfect game for kids. The first twenty levels are easy, but the final ten do get challenging. In a way that’s quality game design, but in another there are so many hardcore platformers out there that forget that even easy games can be fun.

17925316.review:
Commander Cool 2 es un "shooter" de plataformas, donde lucharás en la edad de piedra tras viajar en el tiempo. Es un juego que recuerda a los plataformas arcade de antaño, introduciendo un modo cooperativo de hasta cuatro jugadores.

Un juego de mecánicas sencillas, salta y dispara, y que escala rápidamente en dificultad, llegando a ser un reto importante en fases avanzadas del juego. El juego establece tres retos en cada uno de los niveles desbloqueando con la consecucion de cada uno de ellos una estrella que nos permite desbloquear fases posteriores.
Es un juego entretenido, pero el problema es ese, unicamente entretenido, no da para mucho mas que para pasarte las 40 fases de la historia principal. El multijugador es repetitivo, aunque no niego que este bien para pasar una tarde agradable con amigos, pero no es una maravilla tampoco. Ademas, las diferentes eras temporales de la campaña al parecer apareceran como DLC, por lo que el precio del juego final puede verse incrementado.

Posee un editor de mapas, que si en un futuro incrementa una Workshop puede dar mucha vida al juego si mantiene una comunidad relativamente activa.

Conclusion

Es un juego que he jugado mediante una key proporcionada por orlygift, no creo que fuera un juego que llegase a comprarme. Si tienes 4 amigos dispuestos a comprarlo, lo encuentras en rebajas, o en un futuro desarrolla un apartado en la Workshop, es un juego que posiblemente merezca la pena.

When I first started the game, it looked a lot like a game ported from android, mostly because of gems unlocking skins, the 3 star system, and some of the design.

To my surprise, the game showed a lot more depth than expected, especially with it's engaging physics system. I also like how the weapon you get is most of the time not a 'press button to kill stuff' thingie, but they usually need a bit more timing a placement of your guy so you don't get hurt, and I would especially like to point out using the begginer weapon to throw enemies off cliffs.

Overall a cool game, and while it seems a bit pricey at 8€, so far it seems like the game has got the content for it, and is still in early access, meaning the devs will mostly likely fill it with more interesting content. Here's hoping for weapons and cool maps!

Also, this game has coop, and while I have yet to play it with someone, it sounds like awesome, and is really fitting a game like this.

Also, Commander Cool can dress up as a shark.

17921526.review: Um jogo de plataforma 2D de tiro que cumpre o que se propõe, muito divertido. A cutscene inicial é não verbal, as falas dos personagens são literalmente "blablabla", o patrão ranzinza humilha o faxineiro que se rebela, rouba a máquina do tempo da empresa e viaja para a idade da pedra, então o velhote chama o herói do jogo (você) para usar um protótipo da máquina do tempo e recuperar a versão final que foi roubada. Em todas as fases você começa com um tronco que atira pedras, como se fosse a arma de fogo dos homens das cavernas, e em algumas fases você pode pegar alguma outra arma, apenas durante aquela fase, as que eu vi até agora foram o lançador de foguetes do tutorial, uma besta e uma galinha que atira ovos. Você pode matar os inimigos com dano, jogando-os em armadilhas ou derrubando-os. Dispõe também das habilidades de pulo duplo e "impulso na parede" para alcançar lugares mais altos e pegar itens inacessíveis de alguma outra forma. Tem também um sistema de missões e estrelas que vai de 1 a 3 estrelas de acordo com as missões completadas na fase, que são de completar antes de certo tempo (a mais difícil), pegar todas as moedas, e não levar dano nenhum. Tem também um cristal coletável em cada fase que eu ainda não sei para que serve. Além de sua posição no ranking de melhores desempenhos em cada fase. E também um multiplayer que ainda não achei gente online para eu poder testar.

17921461.review:
Da ich aus Prinzip Spielen in der „Early Access“ Phase keine negative Bewertung geben würde, erhält Commander Cool 2 auch keine. Es wäre aber wahrscheinlich eine geworden, wenn das Spiel nicht noch in Entwicklung sei..

Das liegt hauptsächlich daran, dass es sich wie ein kostenloses Flash Game anfühlt. Die Spielmechanik (sehr kurze Level mit 3-Sterne-Rating), der Comic-Stil und auch die Musik sowie Soundeffekte weisen darauf hin. Tatsächlich wurde CC2 übrigens in Unity programmiert..

Um die Sammelkarten zu farmen, habe ich nicht aufgegeben und eine Weile weitergespielt. Mit der Zeit hat es immer mehr Spaß gemacht, zum Beispiel gibt es bestimmte „Event-Level“, die einen doch noch überraschen können. Und die Dinos in der bisher einzigen Welt (von voraussichtlich drei?) sind ja auch ganz süß - so lange man auf ihnen fliegen kann ;)

Schade ist, dass einige Achievements momentan nicht funktionieren. Der direkte, schnelle und freundliche Kontakt zu den Entwicklern via Steam-Foren hat aber bestätigt, möglichst bald ein großes Update hinterher zuschieben. Klasse!

User haben auch die Möglichkeit, eigene Level mit Software von Drittanbietern zu kreieren - dies, sowie den lokalen Mehrspieler-Modus habe ich leider nicht testen können. Vermutlich wird die Zeitreise mit Commander Cool auch erst dann richtig interessant und witzig. Daher würde ich mich über Online Multiplayer Support freuen.

Zum Schluss noch ein schnelles Lob an das tolle animierte Intro, welches (grafisch/designtechnisch) vermutlich am aufwendigsten vom ganzen Spiel war.

Ich werde, sobald die anderen Welten (Piraten! Zukunft! Hallelujah!) verfügbar sind, nochmal reinschauen und mich überraschen lassen. Geplant sind Episoden / eine richtige Story und vieles mehr (der Early Access Box zu entnehmen). Bis dahin schlage ich vor, Commander Cool nur im Sale zu kaufen, da die 8 Euronen für den derzeitigen Stand doch noch etwas viel sind.

17907722.review:
[b]Full Disclosure[/b]: I received the game from OrlyGift for the purpose of reviewing.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The game has a familiar overworld map, the style of which is used in a variety of games like this.  The game felt like a variety of minigames with commmon objectives.

There are three "Star" objectives per level which require you to complete the level in a specified manner (take no damage, get all coins, etc) and one "Crystal" which is placed in each level.  In most games like this, the "Crystal" objective would be much harder to find or actually reach.  This is not the case here.

The Stars and Crystals are used to progess to later levels.  Crystals also unlock skins (which are varied and interesting).


[h1]Art[/h1]
The art style is very modern American.  It would feel at home on Adult Swim.  Hard lines, contrasting colors, and videos that almost feel like they came from the 90's (in the best way).

[h1]Pros/Cons[/h1]
[b]PROs[/b]
[list]
[*] Simple to pick up
[*] Difficult to complete
[*] Entertaining Story
[*] Fun skins
[/list]

[b]CONs[/b]
[list]
[*] The controls are a bit strange at times.  A great example of this is the double-jump mechanic.
[*] Can run off the screen and die in some places
[*] Menus are rough.  There is no easy way to change skins unless you're in a level.
[/list]

17898102.review:
Commander Cool 2 е типичен представител на жанра си, и като такъв няма да ви изненада с история, развитие на персонажа и други отнемащи внимание подробности.
За да не разваля удоволствието ви от играта, ще спомена само две неща – машина на времето и динозаври. И като чели това е достатъчно за добра основа за забавление.
Самата игра е изградена от множество поднива, които минавайки ги и събирайки звезди, получавани при изпълнение на задачите, се предвижвате към финалната си цел. И като споменах звезди е редно да уточня, че може да получите до три във всяка едно ниво като всяка една от тях се присъжда за скорост, събиране на всички монети и преминаване на нивото, без да загубите “кръв”. И докато самите нива не са особено трудни за преодоляване, събирането и на трите звезди може да се окаже доста трудна задача, която да налага преиграването на едно и също ниво няколко пъти.
Играта е забавна и е особено подходяща за онези дни, в които нямате много време за игра и искате да се отпуснете за 10-15 минути. В този ред на мисля Commander Cool 2 може много лесно да намери почитатели и сред мобилните геймъри.
Въпреки положителния тон до момента, не мога да пропусна и някои проблеми – най-големият е поддръжката на контролери, които просто не работят. Разработчикът е обещал в следващите ъпдейти този недостатък да бъде отстранен. Наличен е и проблем с постиженията като някои не се отключват. Все пак играта е все още в “Ранен достъп”, така че наличието на проблеми не е изненадващо. Важното е разработчикът да ги коригира своевременно.
В крайна сметка, моят съвет е изчакайте разработчикът да оправи проблемите и я вземето когато е намалена.

17883401.review:
DISCLAIMER: Review copy provided by orlygift and developer.

I know what you might say: "They bought your vote!". But this is not true. Orlygift is a really awesome thing, because Commander Cool 2 easily could have been just another game in my ever growing Library, but since I had 1 week to write a review, I had a motive to play this game, and I'm glad I did.

Commander Cool 2 is a max 4 player platform game. According to its story, a grumpy janitor steals a time machine, so the company calls YOU to use a time machine prototype, travel back in time and recover the original. The levels take place in pre-historic times, where your enemies are cavemen and slightly more evolved people. On each level you have 4 tasks to do for 100% completion, collect all coins, complete the level in time, don't take any damage and collect the hidden crystal. Of course, you don't have to complete all on one run, so a maximum of 4 playthrough each level should be enough for maximum completion. Most of the time you just have to get from A to B, where B is your time machine, but every fifth level features a boss battle.

Graphics are okay. Nothing extra, but they aren't ugly either. Same for the sounds. Generic, but okay. And since this is a co-op game (too) you expect me to say something about the multiplayer too, right? Well I can't say much, since the game only has local co-op yet. This may or may not change, since it's Early Access.

VERDICT

A nice little platform game, which is perfect for older machines too. If you love platformers, go for it.

17852872.review:
- super geile Grafik
- einfache Steuerung
- viele Levels
- bestens für einen Controller
- tolles Jump&Run Gameplay
- sammelbares (Münzen und Edelsteine)
- Boss Kämpfe
- abwechslungsreiche Waffen
- abwechslungsreiche Gegner
- ein Level war verbuggt

Einfach ein geiler Plattformer. Der auch jetzt schon sehr gut zu Spielen ist. 
Durch die einzigartige Grafik und Leveldesign, macht es einfach Spaß.

In jedem Level gibt es drei Sterne zu verdienen : 
alle Münzen sammeln, unter einer bestimmten Zeit das Level abgeschließen und kein Schaden erleiden. Diese Sterne sind in dem Game wichtig, denn ab eine bestimmte Anzahl an Sternen wird erst das nächste Level freigeschaltet. Da reicht es nicht, wenn man nur eine von den drei Aufgaben erfüllt. Ebenfalls ist es erfolderlich ein Edelstrein pro Level zu sammeln, denn auch diese werden benötigt um weitere Level freizuschalten.

Ich habe zwar kein Geld für das Game ausgegeben, aber die 7,99 € (Vollreis) lohnen sich und ist vollkommen fair.

17851748.review:
Commander Cool 2 is a fairly generic platformer. It's definitely not an amazing game and there is no potential in the game to achieve that level after early access. It's just barely decent. There is however potential with some finetuning from the developer to make a decent game (from a 5.5/10 as it is now, to a 7.0/10).

My main motivation for this negative recommendation is due to the progression system. Every level you  can achieve three stars and one diamond. You get a star for collecting all coins in a level, finishing the level within a time limit and not getting hurt in a level. The diamond you just have to find. The problem with collecting stars is the fact that it's mandatory. Progress is blocked when you haven't achieved enough stars to progress. The fix is very easy: make it optional. For me it killed the flow of the game and my enjoyment of it.

It seems impossible to finish a level within the time limit. Because I cannot achieve this star in any level, I'm stuck at level 9 (of 33) and cannot progress any further. The main reason why I cannot complete this star is because of a second problem with the game: the controls are way off and not responsive at all. This needs to get fixed before the release. If you fail it should be because you made a mistake, but not because the controls let you down.

Also the graphics has two main problems. The animation really, really sucks. It's very noticable that they have used Spriter in the most basic way possible. It can be a lot better. The second part is the rock textures. They are ugly and detract from the overall visual quality. The rest is decent enough, but the rock textures are plain bad. Because they have a very strong presence, it negatively affects the perception of the game.

The price is pretty high for a generic platformer that's very light on content. Even with extra planned content, it's impossible to think €7,99 is a good price. I would urge the developers to not raise the price, but instead lower it to at least € 4,99. The game isn't good enough and never will be to warrant that price. 

If the issues I have mentioned are fixed on release and if I didn't already had the game, I would have considered to buy the game in a sale (€2,49 - €2,99). Using the steam review system you can only choose recommended or not recommended. If there was a third option called maybe, I would have chosen that instead. But in it's current state I cannot recommend this game. 

FULL DISCLOSURE: I have recieved this game for free from the developer.

17834603.review:
It's an entertaining platform game where your goal is to hop into the time machine at the end of each level and defeat the ultimate boss. Although it's pretty traditional platformer genre, its colorful and comic design has been a spotlight. As the game progresses, you will be able to unlock all kinds of skins. You, riding a dinosaur, equipped with rockets, is getting chased by a giant dinosaur. 

As of the gameplay, it now consists of 33 levels as of Early Access 1201. Each level has similar missions--beat the level within a certain time (vary between different levels), collect all coins, and take no damage. While passing the level may not be difficult, it definitely takes some practice to achieve all the goals. Actually some levels, especially later on, can get really challenging depending on how the traps and obstacles are laid out. With enemies throwing stones and spears, the level becomes harder to achieve the no-damage mission. For speedrun, you may allow yourself to take some damage and overlook some enemies, as all you do is catch up time. Fortunately you can achieve all the goals in different playthroughs, so you don't have to worry about killing all enemies and collecting all coins while trying to be fast without getting hurt. In later levels teleporters will become critical to pass the level, those portals may transport you to some surprising locations, though--you may find yourself in the middle of enemies or spike thingy, or empty space that makes you fall to death. The final level majorly consists of the giant dinosaur whom you must beat with rockets. Keep in mind the rocket is only effective when hit on the dinosaur’s back, so take full advantage of the wall since you are able to jump higher through walls, land on the temporary platform, and get yourself some time for the dinosaur to move away.

Meanwhile, I have noticed some minor downsides in the game. The program does occasionally crash for some reason I haven't figured out. There is no option to sprint, so player might feel a bit uncomfortable. Even though the game is in story mode, there is actually only a beginning cutscene, but as you go through the levels you will not see anymore, even after beating the final boss. When getting back to the main world and choosing levels you might find hopping through every level a hassle since all the 33 levels are connected by a winding route and cannot be chosen with a faster way. Nevertheless, as early access stage the entertainment is very satisfactory and performance issue is nearly imperceptible other than the occasional crash. As the development goes on I believe that bugs will be fixed and more content will be added.

In general, this is a game worth playing, it's quite entertaining because of the challenges as well as the graphics. The game is not perfect, but I can see the hard work behind the developers and would play more if new maps and more playing modes are added.

17813868.review:
The first thing that came to my mind after playing Commander Cool 2 for a while was: Damn, this is exactly like Mechanic Escape! In fact, there are a lot of similarities. Most of the mechanics are the same, for example, such as double jump, wall grind or even unlockable skins for your character after a bunch of rounds done. Some silly achievements are also similar, like die x times, then die xx times, kill x enemies, collect x coins.

Now, does this make CC2 a bad game? No, not at all. Even if they did got inspiration from Mechanic Escape, they did created a new valid game, fun to play, and with a complete different "face". The pre-historic theme is well developed, appart historic fails, but overhall they did a good job on putting it all together in a fun to play fashion. Most of the achievements are pretty easy to obtain, too, so if you are a achievement-dude, it is well worth spending some time in here.

Some levels are very easy - others not so much. But by playing on you will get to understand all the game mechanics, which will help you understanding what or how you have to do. 

The terrain graphics flicker a lot, not as much as to the point of hurting your eyes, but when you notice it it's a bit irritating. I also noticed some "bad" finishing at the pink-dinossaurs that you use to jump (the begging of their tales seem very very irregular).

Includes trading cards, which is always nice. I have no opinion on the versus mode as I haven't found anyone to play with so far. 

Overhall, yes, I do recomend this game, and since it is in early access I am hoping the devs do work out the little things on the game.

17108803.review: Was ist Commander Cool 2? Ein Levelbasierter Shooter/Jump n Run in dem Ihr viele Sachen einsammeln könnt bzw. müsst. Ihr seid Commander Cool (schätze ich mal) und müsst euch durch Level aus der Steinzeit kämpfen, dabei gibt es immer eine bestimmte Anzahl an Münzen und einen Diamanten zu finden, welcher später wichtig ist um neue Level Freizuschalten. Dabei muss erwähnt werden das die Steuerung mit Tastatur wirklich sehr genau ist, durch den Doppelsprung und das Sliden an der Wand könnt Ihr auch Sprünge die nicht gut gehen würde auf die richtige Bahn zurück bringen. In jeden Level könnt Ihr 3 Sterne bekommen ( jeweils für: Ohne Schaden, mit allen Münzen und in einer bestimmten Zeit geschafft), diese Sterne bringen euch wie die Diamanten später in neue Level, welche Ihr nur damit Freischalten könnnt. Auch zu erwähnen ist hier noch das Commander Cool 2 einen Koop Modus und einen Vs Modus bietet, welchen ich leider nicht testen könnte, doch aufgrund des Spielmechanik wird dieser sicher auch recht Spaßig sein. Aufgrund dieser vielen positiven Eigenschaften bekommt das Spiel von mir einen Daumen nach ganz oben.

15623273.review:
[u][b][h1]Commander Cool 2[/h1][/b][/u]

Commander Cool 2 ist ein kleiner Arcade-Jump'n'Run-Shooter für zwischendurch


[b][h1]~~~ Musik und Ton ~~~[/h1][/b]

Die Musik sowie die Vertonung der Gegner sind relativ minimalistisch und nicht wirklich nervig.
Es ist zwar nicht das Beste, aber es fällt auch nicht so in's Gewicht als dass man damit nicht leben könnte.
Die Musik läuft im Hintergrund unentwegt und soll etwas mehr Action vermitteln.
Die Soundeffekte der Steinzeitmenschen sind mittelmäßig. 
Minimalistische Stöhnlaute bei Treffern und Tod sind in Ordnung und zu verschmerzen.
Es ist auch irgendwo verständlich dass unsere früheren... "Artgenossen" keine Sprache gemeistert haben, dennoch wäre etwas mehr Luft nach oben in Sachen Abwechslung gegeben.


[b][h1]~~~ Grafische Darstellung ~~~[/h1][/b]

Sieht so aus wie man es von einem 2D Arcadeshooter erwarten würde. Ist in Ordnung, aber sieht teilweise sehr nach Kindergeburtstag aus. Auch dieser Punkt ist allerdings durchaus zu verschmerzen. Sämtliche Darstellungen sind im Comic-Stil gehalten. Wer besonders viel mehr erwartet von einem Spiel dessen Genres wird wohl nicht fündig werden. 
Dieser Cartoon-Style ist eine kleine Abwechslung, sonst ist man ja immer Pixelgrafik gewöhnt.


[b][h1]~~~ Gameplay ~~~[/h1][/b]

Auch hier im Gameplay gibt es nichts Anspruchsvolles zu erwähnen.
Steuerung ist einfach gehalten und sollte bei einem 2D Spiel auch nicht besonders viel Komplexität haben.
Es gibt einweisende Tutorials ganz am Anfang die die Tastenbelegung erklärt, danach kann man sofort loslegen ohne irgendwelche Tutorialmissionen abschließen zu müssen.
Aber auch das wäre bei einem Jump'n'Run mit Shooterelementen fehl am Platz.
Dennoch ist "Commander Cool 2" sehr linear, spielt sich wie am Fließband und bietet wenig bis keine Abwechslung.
Waffen die hier und da in Boxen bereitgestellt sind und quasi darauf warten aufgenommen zu werden erinnern ein wenig mit ihrer Absurdität an andere bekannte Spiele die dieses Konzept bereits übernommen haben.
Gefühlt befindet man sich kontinuierlich wie in einer Schießbude mit ein paar Sprungaktionen, wirklich anspruchsvoll ist das nicht und auch vom Schwierigkeitsgrad her ist es vor allem für Gelegenheitsspieler zu empfehlen.


[b][h1]~~~ Bewertung ~~~[/h1][/b]
Wer nicht zu viel und kein Spiel dass einen durch actiongeladene Level zieht erwartet, kann hierbei durchaus den Tag ruhig ausklingen lassen. Perfekt für diejenigen, die einfach mal das Hirn und alle reflexartigen Handlungen abschalten möchten.

+ Simple Steuerung
+ Einfaches und ruhiges Spiel
+ Casual-Gamer werden hiermit wohl eher Spaß haben
- Für alle anspruchsvolleren Spieler ist es eher nicht geeignet
- Langzeitmotivation gibt es hier nicht (Ausschließlich für Zwischendurch)


Nichts desto trotz ist das Spiel noch in der Early-Access, vielleicht wird es hier und da noch Neuerungen geben.

15602164.review:
Well, this is a hard one. On one side, i had some funny hours with this game. On the other side, there is nothing in this game that would make it recommendable in it's actual state.

Right now there are 30 levels in the game. Most of them are easy. Really easy. Nearly all times i completed all three challenges (coins, time and no deaths) in two or three runs. Overall that's a playtime of about one to two hours.

So whats next? You can try to speed run all levels. which is quite entertaining. But while doing so, you will encounter to many problems in this game:
[list]
[*] The overall level design isn't that good. Sometimes the levels are boring, sometimes frustrating.
[*] Movement bugs: You can get stuck on edges, you can climb on the level boundary, skipping parts of the level.
[*] Physics: They feel too random sometimes when you get hit by an enemy or jump on a dinosaur.
[*] Score lists: Combined list for single and coop players (unfair), you can't see who has the highest score, it's too easy to manipulate the score list.
[*] There is no way to rebind your controls and some features like a quick restart are missing.
[/list]

In this state this game isn't worth it's money. You feel like a beta tester who should be paid, no paying to play. With those problems fixed, more levels and maybe online multiplayer this game could get interesting. But in this version it is, even for early access, not enough.

15520960.review:
What if I told you that you play as a man in a shark suit, defeating cavemen with a severed unicorn head that shoots rainbows? If that doesn't get your attention, you can also wear Half-Life's armor while carrying a gatling gun and running from a tyrannosaurus rex! Oh if that's not enough for you, you'll also fight a dinosaur with a rocket launcher while dressed as Futurama's Bender, Sailor Moon or anything else you want. There's even four player local coop and death match versus.

Commander Cool 2 is a platforming shooter that has you fighting your way through the stone age in all sorts of unlockable costumes with a variety of weapons. On paper, the game sounds like a blast and for the most part it is. There are just a few things holding it back like jumping issues, game length and how easy it is. Since this is an Early Access game, the short length is forgivable. There's hopefully more to come and the thirty levels show enough promise and let you get a real feel for the game and what its capable of.

The easy difficulty makes it the perfect game for kids. The first twenty levels are easy, but the final ten do get challenging. In a way that's quality game design, but in another there are so many hardcore platformers out there that forget that even easy games can be fun.

On the surface, there's not much going on here, just a simple shooter, but then there are boulders to roll and hop on for extra height. Hop on a sleeping dinosaur's back as a springboard. Keys to unlock switches that control moving platforms. At some point there are teleporters. With all  these goodies, I don't feel like the game used them enough, but that could be because the game is so short. Like all platformers, you'll find plenty of spikes that will instantly kill you.

Commander Cool 2 is a forgiving game. You can take three hits of damage before you're dead. You have infinite lives, so death means you respawn at the beginning of the level. Defeated enemies are still gone, coins are still collected. Later levels even have checkpoint flags due to trickier jumps. Nothing too difficult though.

You'll find plenty of guns from crates. Commander Cool starts with a boulder gun that has a short range projectile that drops to the ground. The arc is rarely put to good use. Other than that, you've got short range shotguns, long range crossbows, even if cavemen never had them, a chicken that fires long range eggs, a gatling gun that sprays at a quick pace. The other weapons seem to have a slow deliberate pace that forces you to aim or it'll be another second before you can fire again.

These cavemen foes are no pushovers, they can take a lot of damage, and shooting one means they'll charge at you. Most people would run away from a slick dude wearing shades shooting at them, but these foes charge! You'll find giant Venus fly traps, cave men that throw rocks, others that throw flaming spears and all sorts of hazards. Smashing rocks, flying spiked boulders that get dropped out of no where. It makes for some good timing sections, but its never too difficult.

The game is setup like a mobile game, you've got ten levels in each section of the campaign. You select a level and unlock them by completing one. At the end, you hop in your time machine and receive stars for three things: getting to the exit in under par time, never dying and collecting all of the coins. These are just meaningless goals for people that want achievements.

At every tenth level is a dinosaur chase that really helps break up the pace of the game. You'll fly on pterodactyls, get chased by a dinosaur and even fight one. There's no going back here, so you'll need to quickly collect the coins or if you're like me, you'll miss them all and just exit the level.

Each level has a crystal to collect in order to purchase  the costumes. These costumes are just personal preference and don't do anything different. In four player cooperative, its a good way to tell yourself apart from everyone else. You're bound to find something you want, even if they don't have a license to use them and might get forced to be patched out.

There' 360 controller support, but you're still forced to use a mouse for the menu. Other than that there's keyboard support. The controls are simple they could have been played on a NES controller. You have  left and right to move, one button to shoot your gun left or right, a jump and mid air double jump. Commander Cool can also wall jump, but it feels a little stiff compared to other games. You'll need to push into the wall and jump then pull away from the wall to get distance. There's also a button to change your costume and an action button for pulling levers. Pushing down does nothing, unless you're on a floating platform, then you'll automatically fall through it when other games require you to push down and jump to fall through.

With that said, the jump feels floaty, almost to gravity defying. That's just how it is, but the major sticking point I have with the double jump is the lack of control. If you jump out once, you can't jump back for your second jump, instead you'll need to go out further or else you'll drop like a stone. You're stuck unable to move from this drop. There are vertical levels that I've fallen a few screens before I had control to move left or right again.

One of the only consistently difficult parts of the game are hanging rock platforms. You need to land on them precisely or you'll be wobbling all over the place. If you fall off or hit the rocks too hard they'll begin to swing and once they're swinging, they'll never stop. It just makes a tough moment far more difficult. Of course restarting the level is a good option. None of the levels are too long, most are under two minutes. There's a good bit of exploration for the coins, but nothing that will ever take you away from the map. Every level is contained in one map.

In terms of frills, there's a versus mode for local death matches. There are even custom maps, but no map editor in game. This can extend the game's life, but only if the fans take to it. The developer has included a few map scraps so that you can use a third party editor to make something. These maps only have a beginning and an end with nothing in between.

The story happens in a skipable intro. A downtrodden janitor hops in a television that's really a time machine. The corporate boss has just the man to call, Commander Cool of course who you'll see in shades on a beach surrounded by beautiful women. He pulls off his Oculus Rift to discover that it wasn't real. You'll then hop into a different rust bucket of a time machine and the animated introduction ends. Normally I don't discuss intros or stories, but this was entertaining and I missed it completely by jumping straight to the menu.

As for the animation arms swing with no elbow movement. Maybe that's just the cavemen. As for the music, its nothing memorable or detrimental. It fits the vibe and the sound design is much better. Shotguns blasting, rockets exploding and happy joyful chimes at the end of each level.

One of the pet peeves I have is when you start the game and go to select one of the three campaigns to play, you'll discover that the game only has one campaign. The other two are future DLC. While I have no problem with DLC or playing for an extra campaign, the last thing I want to see after I've bought a game is being lead to believe that I only bought one third of the game. I remember back in the days of Shareware when you got the first campaign free, but teased with everything the full game has to offer.

In the end, Commander Cool 2 isn't a game for everyone. Its easy, imperfect and short. Its still a fun game that leaves me wanting more. I'd like to thank Christian for giving me a copy of the game. If the game didn't have its charm and silliness I'd say avoid it. There's just something fun about the costumes, predicaments and weapons that overcomes any jump issues.

15503633.review:
My review for this game as it stands is tentatively positive. 

Commander Cool is a retro style platformer with colorful modern sprite graphics and a comedic look, where you play Duke Nuken lookalike hunting a time machine stealing janitor through history (although only the prehistoric era is available now).

The platforming elements are really solid, including some of the physics elements like the swinging stones and rolling bolders, although I'd still say the weapons/enemy gameplay needs a lot of work. Some weapons, like the default rock launcher are awful and require too many shots to kill anything, slowing things down, while others one shot enemies with ease. And there's no logic or effort to getting the upgrades, the maps just toss them in your path (or don't).

The game has three challenges and a hidden item per level, which are all pretty short. Only the time trial mode tends to be challenging, but its usually very hard, which does provide something nice for platformer enthuiasts to shoot for, even comparing their scores on each level.

Ultimately, this is an OK game right now, but with the level editor and promise of online (instead of local) multiplayer it should have some room to grow in the future.

You can also check out a longer review at the DecrypedGaming blog, [url=http://decryptedgaming.com/all-review-list/commander-cool-2-review/]here[/url].
